STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
November 30, 2021
Jennifer Shores
Saginaw County DHHS
P O Box 5070
411 E Genesee
Saginaw, MI 48605
RE: License #: CP730201395
Saginaw County DHHS
P O Box 5070
411 E Genesee
Saginaw, MI 48605
Dear Ms. Shores:
Attached is the Interim Report for the above referenced facility completed on 11/09/2021.
Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, sections of the contract and Modified
Implementation, Sustainability and Settlement (MISEP) requirements, a written corrective
action plan is required. It should be noted that violations of any licensing rules are also
violations of the MISEP and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days
from the date of this letter and must include the following:
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 552-3662.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Mark R. Hunter, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
411 Genesee
P.O. Box 5070
Saginaw, MI 48605
(989) 395-2847
enclosure
2

DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except
for the following:
R 400.12327 Special evaluation.
(1) An agency shall do all of the following when anyone in
the agency receives information that relates to possible
noncompliance with any foster home rule:
(d) Notify all social service workers who have children
placed in the home that a special evaluation has been
initiated.
Two of the two special investigations reviewed as a part of this evaluation did not
include documentation the social service workers of the children in the home were
notified that a special evaluation was initiated.
R 400.12327 Special evaluation.
(6) An agency shall do all of the following:
(c) Provide a copy of the report to any social services
worker that has children placed in the home.
Two of the two special investigations reviewed as a part of this evaluation did not
include documentation the social service worker of the children in the home were
given a copy of the special investigation. REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
Previously cited 7/27/2020 Renewal, CAP Approved 09/04/2020.
R 400.12327 Special evaluation.
(7) If any violations are cited and there is a signed
corrective action plan, all social service workers who have
children placed in the home shall be notified there is a
corrective action plan and what is required of the foster
parent in that plan.
3

One of the two special investigations reviewed as a part of this evaluation required a
corrective action plan and there was no documentation the social service worker
was informed what was required in the corrective action plan.
R 400.12413 Medical and dental care policy.
(1) An agency's medical and dental care policy shall, at a
minimum, include all of the following:
(c) A physical examination for each child as follows,
unless a greater frequency is medically indicated:
(ii) For a child 2 years of age or older, a physical
examination shall have been completed within 12 months
before placement or a new physical examination shall be
completed within 30 calendar days after placement.
Two of the eleven foster care youth records reviewed indicated the youth did not
have a completed physical examination as required by this rule. In the first file the
youth had an identified date of placement of 08/27/2021 and there was no
documentation a physical had been completed at the time of this review. In the
second file the youth had an identified date of placement of 06/04/2021 so the
physical was due by 07/04/2021 and it was not completed until 08/17/2021.
R 400.12413 Medical and dental care policy.
(1) An agency's medical and dental care policy shall, at a
minimum, include all of the following:
(f) The provision of a dental examination and any
treatment required for each child who is 4 years of age and
older, including both of the following:
(i) A dental examination within 12 months before
placement or a new dental examination shall be completed
not more than 90 calendar days after placement.
Two of the eleven foster care youth records reviewed indicated the youth did not
have a completed dental examination within the time frame required by this rule. In
the first file the youth had an identified date of placement of 08/27/2021 and there
was no documentation the youth had a completed dental exam at the time of this
review. This was one of the same youth that also did not have a completed physical
examination. The second file had an identified date of placement of 01/08/2021 and
there was no documentation a dental examination had yet been completed at the
time of this review.
4

R 400.12509 Independent living record.
(3) The case record shall contain all of the following
information and documentation, which shall be recorded
within 30 calendar days after placement in independent
living and updated at least once every 90 calendar days:
(o) Service plans as required in R 400.12419 and R
400.12420. If the youth has biological children, the service
plan must address the living arrangement for the child or
children, visitation/parenting time with the youth's
biological children or a clear explanation why this is not
possible or appropriate.
One of the three independent living youth records reviewed contained an updated
service plan that was not completed within the time frame required by this rule. In
this file the updated service plan had a time frame ending date of 06/07/2021 and
the updated service plan was identified as completed 06/15/2021.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there
are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The
facility is in compliance will all additional MISEP requirements.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHHS Contract violation. Please note that
there are additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included in
section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHHS Contract/Policy
requirement.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance regarding the significance of obtaining
dated signatures on required documents within the timeline expectations.
V. CONSULTATION
No consultation was needed or requested.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plan not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period, for the renewal evaluation completed
07/27/2020 that was approved 09/04/2020. Areas identified in noncompliance as a
part of that review were 212(3)(a), 306(4), 324(8), 326(1)(c)(d), 327(5)(d),
5

327(6)(c),405(3)(e), 417(1)(c)(d)(e)(f)(g), 418(2)(b), 419(1)(c), MCL 722.120(3),
ISEP 4.22, ISEP 6.30, ISEP 6.33, ISEP 6.49, Policy FOM 722-6H, 8E, 9, 15, and
CI17-099. The only area identified as repeat noncompliance as a part of this interim
evaluation is 327(6)(c).
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment reviewed areas of noncompliance and barriers
to establishing and maintaining compliance. The report presented resources/tools
that are used to monitor progress in establishing compliance in a variety of areas.
This included the action steps to be taken and the identification of those responsible
for completing the action steps.
Interviews
Child welfare staff participated in entrance and exit meetings. Individual staff
interviews did not present any unusual/significant problems and expectations.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There were no identified safety concerns.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon
receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility
continue on a regular license.
11/29/2021
________________________________________
Mark R. Hunter Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
November 30, 2021
________________________________________
Claudia Triestram Date
Area Manager
